1. Conduct regular security assessments: Regular security assessments should be performed to identify vulnerabilities in the system and keep them up to date.

2. Implement employee training program: Companies should invest in employee training to help educate them and sensitise them into keeping email and other online communications secure.

3. Develop incident response plan: Companies should develop an incident response plan to ensure that they quickly respond to any cyber-attack, contain the damage and recover data quickly.

4. Ensure regular software updates: All the software used in the organization must be updated regularly to fix any security loopholes.

5. Implement access and authentication policies: Companies should implement access and authentication policies to restrict access rights to only authorized personnel.

6. Maintain regular backups: Regular backups help to ensure that in case of any cyber-attack, data can be retrieved easily.

7. Use encryption: Companies should use encryption and other encryption tools to protect their data.

8. Implement firewalls and intrusion prevention systems: Firewalls and intrusion prevention systems can help prevent cyber-attacks and reduce their impact on the organization.

9. Conduct regular security audits: Companies should conduct regular security audits to ensure that their systems are secure and there are no security vulnerabilities that could be exploited.

10. Work with a security partner: Companies can work with a security partner to help them monitor their systems, identify and mitigate the risks.
